greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First prime of A031938 (lesser of primes differing by 20) whose distance to the next 20-twin increases.
comment: The smallest distance between 20-twins is 24 [= A052380(10)], while its minimal increment is 6.
a(n)=p starts [p,p+20,p+6n+18,p+6n+38] and [20,6n-2,20] patterns of primes and their difference.
formula: a(n)=p is the smallest prime which starts a [p, p+20] twin followed by the next [p+6n+18, p+6n+18+20] twin.
example: n=11 a(11)=5903 yields [5903,5923,5987,6007] or [20,64,20] with 4 primes in the medial gap.
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Mar 07 2000
ext: Offset changed to 1 by _Michel Marcus_, Apr 30 2019
